Question: What is the difference between a "bond" and a "debt"?

The issuer of the bond is obligated to repay the principal amount of the bond plus interest to the holder of the bond at the maturity date.
A debt is a financial obligation that is owed by one party to another. It can be a loan, a credit card balance, or a mortgage. The debtor is obligated to repay the debt to the creditor at a specified date or at the end of a specified period.

The employer may require employees to spread their 401(k) contributions throughout the year to get the maximum match because it is a way to ensure that the employee is making the maximum contribution possible. Additionally, spreading the contributions throughout the year can help the employee to avoid the "tax-free" penalty, which is a tax penalty that can be imposed on employees who do not contribute to their 401(k) plan for a certain period of time.

Passive investors typically have lower fees than active investors, as the investment manager is responsible for managing the portfolio.
